results.title: Improper Authorization
results.author: Matteo Collina
results.overview: Versions of `aedes` before 0.35.1 does not respect its own authorization rules when a client sets a `Last Will`.

results.title: Arbitrary File Write via Archive Extraction
results.author: snyk security team
results.overview: Versions of `adm-zip` before 0.4.9 are vulnerable to arbitrary file write when used to extract a specifically crafted archive that contains path traversal filenames (`../../file.txt` for example).

results.title: Arbitrary File Write via Archive Extraction
results.author: snyk security team
results.overview: Versions of `unzipper` before 0.8.13 are vulnerable to arbitrary file write when used to extract a specifically crafted archive that contains path traversal filenames (`../../file.txt` for example).

results.title: Out-of-bounds read
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич
results.overview:
All versions of `njwt` are vulnerable to out-of-bounds reads when a number is passed into the `base64urlEncode` function. 

On Node.js 6.x or lower this can expose sensitive information and on any other version of Node.js this creates a Denial of Service vulnerability.
results.recommendation: As no fix is currently available it is our recommendation if you currently use this module, validate user input passed into this function or do not use this module until it has been patched.

results.title: Open Redirect
results.author: Ahmed
results.overview: Versions of `url-parse` before 1.4.3 returns the wrong hostname which could lead to Open Redirect, Server Side Request Forgery (SSRF), or Bypass Authentication Protocol vulnerabilities.

results.title: Path Traversal
results.author: Patrick
results.overview: Versions of `express-cart` before 1.1.7 are vulnerable to Path Traversal.

results.title: Malicious package
results.author: Eslint team
results.overview: Version 2.0.0 of `eslint-config-airbnb-standard` was published with a bundled version of `eslint-scope` that  was found to contain malicious code. This code would read the users `.npmrc` file and send it's contents to a remote server.
results.recommendation: The best course of action if you found this package installed in your environment is to revoke all your npm tokens and use a different version of the module. You can find instructions on how to do that here. https://docs.npmjs.com/getting-started/working_with_tokens#how-to-revoke-tokens

results.title: Malicious package
results.author: Eslint Team
results.overview: Version 5.0.2 of `eslint-config-eslint` was published without authorization and was found to contain malicious code. This code would read the users `.npmrc` file and send any found authentication tokens to a remote server.
results.recommendation: The best course of action if you found this package installed in your environment is to revoke all your npm tokens. You can find instructions on how to do that here. https://docs.npmjs.com/getting-started/working_with_tokens#how-to-revoke-tokens

results.title: Malicious package
results.author: Andrei Mihailov
results.overview: Version 3.7.2 of `eslint-scope` was published without authorization and was found to contain malicious code. This code would read the users `.npmrc` file and send any found authentication tokens to 2 remote servers.
results.recommendation: The best course of action if you found this package installed in your environment is to revoke all your npm tokens. You can find instructions on how to do that here. https://docs.npmjs.com/getting-started/working_with_tokens#how-to-revoke-tokens

results.title: Information Exposure on Case Insensitive File Systems
results.author: tungpun
results.overview: Versions of `serve` before 7.0.0 are vulnerable to information exposure, bypassing the ignore security control, but only on case insensitive file systems.

results.title: Cross-Site Scripting
results.author: bl4de
results.overview: All versions of `sexstatic` are vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting (xss). This is exploitable if an attacker can control a filename that is served by `sexstatic`.
results.recommendation: As there is no fix is currently available for this vulnerability it is our recommendation to not install or used this module at this time.

results.title: Command Injection
results.author: N B Sri Harshа
results.overview: Versions of `pdf-image` before 2.0.0 are vulnerable to command injection. This vulnerability is exploitable if the attacker has control over the `pdfFilePath` variable passed into `pdf-image`.

results.title: Open Redirect
results.author: panic
results.overview: Versions of `hekto` before 0.2.4 are vulnerable to open redirect when a domain name is used as part of the `.html` filename.

results.title: Cross-Site Scripting
results.author: Ron Perris
results.overview:
All versions of `react-marked-markdown` are vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS) via `href` attributes. This is exploitable if user is provided to `react-marked-markdown`

Proof of concept:

```
import React from 'react'
import ReactDOM from 'react-dom'
import { MarkdownPreview } from 'react-marked-markdown'

ReactDOM.render(
<MarkdownPreview
markedOptions={{ sanitize: true }}
value={'[XSS](javascript: alert`1`)'}
/>,
document.getElementById('root')
)
```
results.recommendation: No fix is currently available for this vulnerability. It is our recommendation to not install or use this module at this time if you allow user input into href values.

results.title: Command Injection
results.author: bl4de
results.overview: All versions of `buttle` are vulnerable to command injection. Remote command execution is possible when `buttle` is run with the `--php-bin` flag.
results.recommendation: No fix is currently available for this vulnerability. It is our recommendation to not install or use this module at this time.

results.title: SQL Injection
results.author: bl4de
results.overview: All versions of `query-mysql` are vulnerable to SQL injection due to lack of user input sanitization allows to run arbitrary SQL queries when fetching data from database.
results.recommendation: No fix is currently available for this vulnerability. It is our recommendation to not install or use this module if user input is passed into this module.

results.title: Path Traversal
results.author: bl4de
results.overview: Versions of `html-pages` before 2.1.0 are vulnerable to path traversal.

results.title: Out-of-bounds Read
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич
results.overview: All versions of `stringstream` are vulnerable to out-of-bounds read as it allocates uninitialized Buffers when number is passed in input stream on Node.js 4.x and below.

results.title: Command Injection
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич
results.overview:
All versions of `open` are vulnerable to command injection when unsanitized user input is passed in.

The package does come with the following warning in the readme:

```
The same care should be taken when calling open as if you were calling child_process.exec directly. If it is an executable it will run in a new shell.
```
results.recommendation: No fix is currently available for this vulnerability. It is our recommendation to not install or use this module until a fix is available.

results.title: SQL Injection
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич
results.overview: All versions of `sql` are vulnerable to sql injection as it does not properly escape parameters when building SQL queries.
results.recommendation: No fix is currently available for this vulnerability. It is our recommendation to not install or use this module until a fix is available.

results.title: Command Injection
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич
results.overview: All versions of `fs-path` are vulnerable to command injection is unsanitized user input is passed in.
results.recommendation: No fix is currently available for this vulnerability. It is our recommendation to not install or use this module until a fix is available.

results.title: Out-of-bounds Read
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич
results.overview: Versions of `base64-url` before 2.0.0 are vulnerable to out-of-bounds read as it allocates uninitialized Buffers when number is passed in input.

results.title: Command Injection
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич
results.overview: Versions of `command-exists` before 1.2.4 are vulnerable to command injection. This is exploitable if user input is provided to this module.

results.title: Out-of-bounds Read
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич
results.overview: Versions of `base64url` before 3.0.0 are vulnerable to to out-of-bounds reads as it allocates uninitialized Buffers when number is passed in input on Node.js 4.x and below.

results.title: Out-of-bounds Read
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич
results.overview: Versions of `byte` before 1.4.1 allocate uninitialized buffers and read data from them past the initialized length

results.title: Path Traversal
results.author: tungpun
results.overview: Versions of `angular-http-server` before 1.4.4 are vulnerable to path traversal.

results.title: Path Traversal
results.author: Caio Lüders
results.overview:
All versions of `localhost-now` are vulnerable to path traversal. This vulnerability is a bypass to the path traversal fix introduced in version 1.0.2

Proof of concept:

```
$ curl -v --path-as-is "http://IP:5432/..././..././..././..././..././..././..././..././..././..././etc/passwd" 
```
results.recommendation: No fix is currently available for this vulnerability. It is our recommendation to not install or use this module until a fix is available.

results.title: Command Injection
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич
results.overview: All versions of `macaddress` are vulnerable to command injection. For this vulnerability to be exploited an attacker needs to control the `iface` argument to the `one` method.

results.title: Out-of-bounds Read
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич
results.overview: Versions of `npmconf` before 2.1.3 allocate and write to disk uninitialized memory contents when a typed number is passed as input on Node.js 4.x.
results.recommendation: Update to version 2.1.3 or later. Consider switching to another config storage mechanism, as npmconf is deprecated and should not be used.

results.title: Path Traversal
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич
results.overview:
All versions of `superstatic` are vulnerable to path traversal when used on Windows. 

Additionally, it is vulnerable to path traversal on other platforms combined with certain Node.js versions which erroneously normalize `\\` to `/` in paths on all platforms (a known example being Node.js v9.9.0).

results.title: Module contains malicious test script
results.author: Simon Werner
results.overview: `ladder-text-js` contained a malicious script that attempted to delete all files when `npm test` was run.
results.recommendation: This module has been unpublished from the npm Registry. If you find this module in your environment remove it.

results.title: Module contains malicious test script
results.author: Simon Werner
results.overview: `nothing-js` contained a malicious script that attempted to delete all files when `npm test` was run.
results.recommendation: This module has been unpublished from the npm Registry. If you find this module in your environment remove it.

results.title: Malicious Module
results.author: npm community
results.overview: The `getcookies` module contained a backdoor that would allow for a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system running the malicious module.
results.recommendation: This module should be uninstalled if found used within an application. In addition to removing the installed module, you will also want to evaluate your application to determine whether or not user data or systems were compromised.

results.title: Cross-Site Scripting
results.author: Ron Perris
results.overview: Versions of `react-svg` before 2.2.18 are vulnerable to cross-site scripting (xss). This is due to the fact that scripts found in SVG files are run by default.

results.title: Denial of Service
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич
results.overview: All versions of `rgb2hex` are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) when an attacker can pass in a specially crafted invalid color value.
results.recommendation: No fix is currently available for this vulnerability. It is our recommendation to not install or use this module until a fix is available.

results.title: Out-of-bounds Read
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич
results.overview: Versions of `atob` before 2.1.0  uninitialized Buffers when number is passed in input on Node.js 4.x and below.

results.title: Denial of Service
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич
results.overview: All versions of `foreman` are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service when requests to it are made with a specially crafted path.
results.recommendation: No fix is currently available for this vulnerability. It is our recommendation to not install or use this module until a fix is available.

results.title: Out-of-bounds Read
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич
results.overview: Versions of `concat-with-sourcemaps` before 1.0.6 allocates uninitialized Buffers when a number is passed as a separator.

results.title: Command Injection
results.author: Caio Lüders
results.overview: Versions of `pdfinfojs` before 0.4.1 are vulnerable to command injection. This is exploitable if an attacker can control the filename parameter that is passed into the `pdfinfojs` constructor.

results.title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
results.author: Tung Pun
results.overview: Versions of `cloudcmd` before 9.1.6 are vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS) when listing files in a directory. The attacker must control the name of a file for this vulnerability to be exploitable.

results.title: Path Traversal
results.author: bl4de
results.overview: All versions of `mcstatic` are vulnerable to path traversal.
results.recommendation: No fix is currently available for this vulnerability. It is our recommendation to not install or use this module at this time.

results.title: Prototype Pollution
results.author: Olivier Arteau (HoLyVieR)
results.overview: Versions of `deep-extend` before 0.5.1 are vulnerable to prototype pollution.

results.title: Prototype Pollution
results.author: Olivier Arteau (HoLyVieR)
results.overview: Versions of `deap` before 1.0.1 are vulnerable to prototype pollution.

results.title: Cross-Site Scripting
results.author: _ bl4de
results.overview:
All versions of `glance` are vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting (XSS)

File name, which could contain malicious HTML (eg. embedded iframe element or javascript: pseudoprotocol handler in `<a>` element) allows to execute JavaScript code against any user who opens directory listing contains such crafted file name.
results.recommendation: No fix is currently available for this vulnerability. It is our recommendation to not install or use this module at this time.

results.title: Cross-Site Scripting
results.author: _ bl4de
results.overview: All versions of `public` are vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting (XSS).
results.recommendation: No fix is currently available for this vulnerability. It is our recommendation to not install or use this module at this time.

results.title: Cross-Site Scripting
results.author: _ bl4de
results.overview: All versions of `bracket-template` are vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting (XSS). This is exploitable when a variable passed in via a GET parameter is used in a template.
results.recommendation: No fix is currently available for this vulnerability. It is our recommendation to not install or use this module at this time.

results.title: Denial of Service
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич
results.overview: Versions of `http-proxy-agent` before 2.1.0 are vulnerable to denial of service and uninitialized memory leak when unsanitized options are passed to `Buffer`.

results.title: Regular Expression Denial of Service
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич
results.overview: Versions of `sshpk` before 1.14.1 are vulnerable to regular expression denial of service when parsing crafted invalid public keys.

results.title: Denial of Service
results.author: Jamie Davis
results.overview: Versions of `protobufjs` before 5.0.3 and 6.8.6 are vulnerable to denial of service when parsing crafted invalid *.proto files.

results.title: Command Injection
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич
results.overview: Versions of `whereis` before 0.4.1 are vulnerable to command injection if untrusted user input is passed into `whereis`.

results.title: Cross-Site Scripting
results.author: _ bl4de
results.overview: All versions of `metascraper` are vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting (XSS).
results.recommendation: No fix is currently available for this vulnerability. It is our recommendation to not install or use this module at this time.

results.title: Remote Memory Exposure
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич
results.overview:
Versions of `mysql` before 2.14.0 are vulnerable to remove memory exposure.

Affected versions of `mysql` package allocate and send an uninitialized memory over the network when a number is provided as a password.

Only `mysql` running on Node.js versions below 6.0.0 is affected due to a throw added in newer node.js versions.

Proof of Concept:

```
require('mysql').createConnection({
  host: 'localhost',
  user: 'user',
  password : USERPROVIDEDINPUT,  // number
  database : 'my_db'
}).connect();
```

results.title: Remote Memory Exposure
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич

results.title: Remote Memory Exposure
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич

results.title: Remote Memory Exposure
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич
results.overview:
Versions of `mongoose` before 4.3.6, 3.8.39 are vulnerable to remote memory exposure.

Trying to save a number to a field of type Buffer on the affected mongoose versions allocates a chunk of uninitialized memory and stores it in the database.

results.title: Memory Exposure
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич

results.title: Memory Exposure
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич
results.overview:
Versions of `concat-stream` before 1.5.2 are vulnerable to memory exposure if userp provided input is passed into `write()`

Versions <1.3.0 are not affected due to not using unguarded Buffer constructor.
results.recommendation:
Update to version 1.5.2, 1.4.11, 1.3.2 or later.

If you are unable to update make sure user provided input into the `write()` function is not a number.

results.title: Memory Exposure
results.author: Feross Aboukhadijeh
results.overview:
Versions of `bl` before 0.9.5 and 1.0.1 are vulnerable to memory exposure.

`bl.append(number)` in the affected `bl` versions passes a number to Buffer constructor, appending a chunk of uninitialized memory

results.title: Cross-Site Scripting
results.author: _ bl4de
results.overview: Versions of `simple-server` before 1.1.0 are vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting (XSS). This is exploitable if an attacker can control a filename on the server.

results.title: Byass due to validation before canonicalization
results.author: digitalwizard
results.overview:
Versions of `serve` before 6.5.2 are vulnerable to the bypass of the ignore functionality. The bypass is possible because validation happens before canonicalization of paths and filenames.



Example:
Here we have a server that ignores the file test.txt.
```
const serve = require('serve')
const server = serve(__dirname, {
      port: 1337,
      ignore: ['test.txt']
})
```

Using the URL encoded form of a letter (%65 instead of e) attacker can bypass the ignore control accessing the file. 

`curl http://localhost:1337/t%65st.txt`

Additionally this technique can be used to get directory listings of ignored directories.

results.title: Denial of Service
results.author: Сковорода Никита Андреевич
results.overview: Versions of `https-proxy-agent` before 2.2.0 are vulnerable to denial of service. This is due to unsanitized options (proxy.auth) being passed to `Buffer()`.

results.title: Path Traversal
results.author: _ bl4de
results.overview: All versions of `general-file-server` are vulnerable to path traversal.
results.recommendation: No fix is currently available for this vulnerability. It is our recommendation to not use this module until a fix has been provided.

results.title: Path Traversal
results.author: _ bl4de
results.overview: Versions of `stattic` before 0.3.0 are vulnerable to path traversal allowing a remote attacker to read arbitrary files with any extension from the server that users `stattic`.

results.title: Path Traversal
results.author: _ bl4de
results.overview: Versions of `glance` before 3.0.4 are vulnerable to path traversal allowing a remote attacker to read arbitrary files from the server using `glance`.

results.title: Path Traversal
results.author: _ bl4de
results.overview: Versions of `angular-http-server` before 1.4.3 are vulnerable to path traversal allowing a remote attacker to read files from the server that uses `angular-http-server`.

results.title: Path Traversal
results.author: _ bl4de
results.overview: Versions of `node-srv` before 2.1.1 are vulnerable to path traversal allowing a remote attacker to read files from the server that uses `node-srv`.

results.title: Cross-Site Scripting
results.author: joker314
results.overview: Versions of `mrk.js` before 2.0.1 are vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS) when markdown is converted to HTML.
results.recommendation: Update to version 2.0.1 or later and use `mark.sanitizeURL()` for any `src` and `href` attributes when extending the markdown.

results.title: Path Traversal
results.author: _ bl4de
results.overview: Versions of `hekto` before 0.2.3 are vulnerable to path traversal. This allows a remote attacker to read content of arbitrary files.

results.title: Stored Cross-Site Scripting
results.author: _ bl4de
results.overview: All versions of simplehttpserver are vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting (XSS). To be exploited an attacker needs to control the filename of a file that is used in the directory listing output.
results.recommendation: No fix is currently available for this vulnerability. It is our recommendation to not use this module if the exploitable conditions are met.

results.title: Cross-Site Scripting
results.author: _ bl4de
results.overview: Versions of `anywhere` before 1.5.0 are vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS).

results.title: Path Traversal
results.author: _ bl4de
results.overview: All versions of `626` are vulnerable to path traversal. This enables a remote attacker to read arbitrary files from the remote server using this module.
results.recommendation:
No fix is currently available for this vulnerability.
It is our recommendation to not install or use this module at this time.

results.title: Path Traversal
results.author: _ bl4de
results.overview: Versions of `localhost-now` before 1.0.2 are vulnerable to path traversal. This allows a remote attacker to read the content of an arbitrary file.

results.title: Prototype Pollution
results.author: Olivier Arteau (HoLyVieR)
results.overview: Versions of `default-deep` before 0.2.4 are vulnerable to prototype pollution

results.title: Prototype Pollution
results.author: Olivier Arteau (HoLyVieR)
results.overview: Versions of `merge-deep` before 3.0.1 are vulnerable to prototype pollution via merging functions.

results.title: Prototype Pollution
results.author: Olivier Arteau (HoLyVieR)
results.overview: Versions of `assign-deep` before 0.4.7 are vulnerable to prototype pollution via merging functions.

results.title: Prototype Pollution
results.author: Olivier Arteau (HoLyVieR)
results.overview: Versions of `mixin-deep` before 1.3.1 are vulnerable to prototype pollution via merging functions.

results.title: Prototype Pollution
results.author: Olivier Arteau (HoLyVieR)
results.overview:
Versions of `lodash` before 4.17.5 are vulnerable to prototype pollution. 

The vulnerable functions are 'defaultsDeep', 'merge', and 'mergeWith' which allow a malicious user to modify the prototype of `Object` via `__proto__` causing the addition or modification of an existing property that will exist on all objects.

results.title: Cross-Site Scripting
results.author: _bayotop
results.overview:
Versions of `html-janitor` prior to 2.0.2 (all current versions) are vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS).

This is exploitable if user-controlled data is passed into the modules `clean()` function.
results.recommendation: No fix is currently available for this vulnerability. It is recommended to use an alternative module for HTML sanitization.

results.title: Failure to sanitize quotes which can lead to sql injection
results.author: Sean Lynch
results.overview:
All versions of `squel` are vulnerable to sql injection.

The `squel` package does not properly escape user provided input when provided using the `setFields` method. This could lead to sql injection if the query was then executed.

Proof of concept demonstrating the injection of a single quote into a generated sql statement from user provided input.
```
> console.log(squel.insert().into('buh').setFields({foo: "bar'baz"}).toString());
INSERT INTO buh (foo) VALUES ('bar'baz')
```
results.recommendation: There is no fix at this time and the issue has been reported publicly. Consider using another query builder that provides strong guarantees for input sanitization to prevent sql injection attacks.

results.title: Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS)
results.author: Jamie Davis
results.overview: Version of `is-my-json-valid` before 1.4.1 or 2.17.2 are vulnerable to regular expression denial of service (ReDoS) via the email validation function.

results.title: Directory Traversal
results.author: bl4de (https://twitter.com/_bl4de)
results.overview: Versions of `public` before 0.1.3 are vulnerable to directory traversal. This is due to lack of file path sanitization which could lead to any file the parent process has access to on the server to be read by malicious user.

results.title: Cross-site Scripting (XSS) - Stored
results.author: bl4de (https://twitter.com/_bl4de)
results.overview: Versions of `crud-file-server` before 0.8.0 are vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting (XSS). This is due to insufficient santiziation of filenames when directory index is served by `crud-file-server`.

results.title: Bypassing Sanitization using DOM clobbering
results.author: _bayotop (https://twitter.com/_bayotop)
results.overview:
All versions of `html-janitor` are vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS).

Arbitrary HTML can pass the sanitization process, which can be unexpected and dangerous (XSS) in case user-controlled input is passed to the clean function."
results.recommendation:
No fix is currently available for this vulnerability.
It is our recommendation to not install or use this module.

results.title: Sandbox Bypass Leading to Arbitrary Code Execution
results.author: Mike Samuel
results.overview: Versions of `constantinople` prior to 3.1.1 are vulnerable to a sandbox bypass which can lead to arbitrary code execution.

results.title: Code Execution by Re-enabling Node.js integration
results.author: Brendan Scarvell
results.overview:
Versions of electron 
A vulnerability has been discovered which allows Node.js integration to be re-enabled in some Electron applications that disable it.

For the application to be impacted by this vulnerability it must meet all of these conditions

- Runs on Electron 1.7, 1.8, or a 2.0.0-beta
- Allows execution of arbitrary remote code
- Disables Node.js integration
- Does not explicitly declare webviewTag: false in its webPreferences
- Does not enable the nativeWindowOption option
- Does not intercept new-window events and manually override event.newGuest without using the supplied options tag

results.title: Path Traversal
results.author: orange_8361 (https://twitter.com/orange_8361)
results.overview: Versions of `resolve-path` before 1.4.0 are vulnerable to path traversal. `resolve-path` relative path resolving suffers from a lack of file path sanitization for windows based paths.

results.title: Authentication bypass via incorrect XML canonicalization and DOM traversal
results.author: Kelby Ludwig
results.overview:
Versions of `saml2-js` prior to 1.12.4 or 2.0.2 are vulnerable to authentication bypass.

The `saml2-js` library may incorrectly utilize the results of XML DOM traversal and canonicalization APIs in such a way that an attacker may be able to manipulate the SAML data without invalidating the cryptographic signature, allowing the attack to potentially bypass authentication to SAML service providers.

Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) is an XML-based markup language for security assertions regarding authentication and permissions, most commonly used for single sign-on (SSO) services.

Some XML DOM traversal and canonicalization APIs may be inconsistent in handling of comments within XML nodes. Incorrect use of these APIs by some SAML libraries results in incorrect parsing of the inner text of XML nodes such that any inner text after the comment is lost prior to cryptographically signing the SAML message. Text after the comment therefore has no impact on the signature on the SAML message.

A remote attacker can modify SAML content for a SAML service provider without invalidating the cryptographic signature, which may allow attackers to bypass primary authentication for the affected SAML service provider
results.recommendation:
If you use 1.x upgrade to version 1.12.4 or greater 
If you use 2.x upgrade to version 2.02 or greater

results.title: Prototype pollution attack
results.author: HoLyVieR

results.title: ReDoS in ssri
results.author: Jamie Davis
results.overview: Version of `ssri` prior to 5.2.2 are vulnerable to regular expression denial of service (ReDoS) when using strict mode.

results.title: Fastify denial-of-service vulnerability with large JSON payloads
results.author: nwoltman (https://github.com/nwoltman)
results.overview: Affected versions of `fastify` are vulnerable to a denial of service when processing a request with `Content-Type` set to `application/json` and a very large payload.

results.title: Remote Code Execution
results.author: Zeke Sikelianos
results.overview:
Affected versions of `electron` may be susceptible to a remote code execution flaw when certain conditions are met:
1. The electron application is running on Windows.
2. The electron application registers as the default handler for a protocol, such as `nodeapp://`.

This vulnerability is caused by a failure to sanitize additional arguments to chromium in the command line handler for Electron.

MacOS and Linux are not vulnerable.
results.recommendation:
Update electron to a version that is not vulnerable. If updating is not possible, the electron team has provided the following guidance:


If for some reason you are unable to upgrade your Electron version, you can append `--` as the last argument when calling `app.setAsDefaultProtocolClient`, which prevents Chromium from parsing further options. The double dash `--` signifies the end of command options, after which only positional parameters are accepted.
```
app.setAsDefaultProtocolClient(protocol, process.execPath, [
  '--your-switches-here',
  '--'
])
```

results.title: Reflected Cross-Site Scripting
results.author: Yasin Soliman (ysx)
results.overview:
Affected versions of `redis-commander` contain a cross-site scripting vulnerability in the `highlighterId` paramter of the clipboard.swf component on hosts serving Redis Commander.

Mitigating factors:
Flash must be installed / enabled for this to work. The below proof of concept was verified to work using Firefox 57.0 on Windows 10 by manually installing the [Flash NPAPI Windows plugin](https://get.adobe.com/flashplayer/otherversions/)

## Proof of concept

```
http://instance/jstree/_docs/syntax/clipboard.swf?highlighterId=\%22))}%20catch(e)%20{alert(document.domain);}//
```
results.recommendation:
No direct patch for this vulnerability is currently available.

At this time, the best mitigation is to use an alternative, functionally equivalent package, or to use extreme caution when using redis-commander, ensuring that redis-commmander is the only web page you have open, and avoiding clicking on any links.

results.title: Directory Traversal
results.author: bl4de (https://twitter.com/_bl4de)
results.overview:
Affected versions of `serve` do not properly handle `%2e` (.) and `%2f` (/) characters, and allow the, characters to be used in paths. This can be used to traverse the directory tree and list content of any directory the user running the process has access to.

Mitigating factors:
This vulnerability only allows listing of directory contents and does not allow reading of arbitrary files.

results.title: Directory Traversal
results.author: Liang Gong
results.overview:
Affected versions of `ltt.js` resolve relative file paths, resulting in a directory traversal vulnerability. A malicious actor can use this vulnerability to access files outside of the intended directory root, which may result in the disclosure of private files on the vulnerable system.

Example request:
```
GET /../../../../../../../../../../etc/passwd HTTP/1.1
host:foo
```
results.recommendation:
No patch is available for this vulnerability.

It is recommended that the package is only used for local development, and if the functionality is needed for production, a different package is used instead.

results.title: Directory Traversal
results.author: Liang Gong
results.overview:
Affected versions of `yjmyjmyjm` resolve relative file paths, resulting in a directory traversal vulnerability. A malicious actor can use this vulnerability to access files outside of the intended directory root, which may result in the disclosure of private files on the vulnerable system.

Example request:
```
GET /../../../../../../../../../../etc/passwd HTTP/1.1
host:foo
```
results.recommendation:
No patch is available for this vulnerability.

It is recommended that the package is only used for local development, and if the functionality is needed for production, a different package is used instead.

results.title: Directory Traversal
results.author: Yasin Soliman (ysx)
results.overview:
A crafted `GET` request can be leveraged to traverse the directory structure of a host using the lactate web server package, and request arbitrary files outside of the specified web root. This allows for a remote attacker to gain access to arbitrary files on the filesystem that the process has access to read.

Mitigating factors:
Only files that the user running `lactate` has permission to read will be accessible via this vulnerability.


[Proof of concept](https://hackerone.com/reports/296645):
Please globally install the `lactate` package and `cd` to a directory you wish to serve assets from. Next, run `lactate -p 8081` to start serving files from this location.

The following cURL request can be used to demonstrate this vulnerability by requesting the target `/etc/passwd` file:

```
curl "http://127.0.0.1:8081/%2e%2e/%2e%2e/%2e%2e/%2e%2e/%2e%2e/etc/passwd"
```
```
root:x:0:0:root:/root:/bin/bash
daemon:x:1:1:daemon:/usr/sbin:/usr/sbin/nologin
bin:x:2:2:bin:/bin:/usr/sbin/nologin
sys:x:3:3:sys:/dev:/usr/sbin/nologin
[...]
```
results.recommendation: As there is currently no fix for this issue selecting an alternative static web server would be the best choice.

results.title: Directory Traversal
results.author: Yasin Soliman (ysx)
results.overview:
Affected versions of `augustine` resolve relative file paths, resulting in a directory traversal vulnerability. A malicious actor can use this vulnerability to access files outside of the intended directory root, which may result in the disclosure of private files on the vulnerable system.

## Proof of Concept
```
GET //etc/passwd HTTP/1.1
host:foo
```
results.recommendation:
No direct patch is available at this time. 

Currently, the best mitigation for this flaw is to use a different, functionally equivalent static file server package.

results.title: Arbitrary Code Injection
results.author: Cristian-Alexandru Staicu

results.title: Denial of Service
results.author: mcollina

results.title: Directory Traversal
results.author: Yasin Soliman
results.overview:
Affected versions of `featurebook` resolve relative file paths, resulting in a directory traversal vulnerability. A malicious actor can use this vulnerability to access files outside of the intended directory root, which may result in the disclosure of private files on the vulnerable system.

The `featurebook` package is not intended to be run in production code nor to be exposed to an untrusted network.


## Proof of Concept
```
GET /../../../../../../../../../../etc/passwd HTTP/1.1
host:foo
```
results.recommendation:
No direct patch is currently available.

At this time, the best mitigation is to ensure that `featurebook` is not running in production or exposed to an untrusted network.
